comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Lovely shot and such handsome people.  When I was a kid the Traveller names were either Sheridan or McCarthy and when I met a man named Sheridan who was not a traveller I was amazed!  These people were very well dressed and very clean which cannot have been easy under the conditions?  I love the painting on the caravan.

comment.author: 28263003@N02
comment._content: Sheridan, but not a traveller - most of the Sheridan travellers were in the munster area - not sure if they all travelled from Cavan/Longford, the home of Sheridans!!  Love the photo - the tea table setting, the ladies dresses and hair do"s -even the boots on the lady sitting makes her look really contemporary in style!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] It is lovely, isn't it? Do you remember this one and this from a while back, Sean? Both were taken by Elinor Wiltshire later the same year, in July...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/paulasheridan] I think she looks really comfortable in her skin! Would love to know what she was waving.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 99684904@N00
comment._content: Camping in style and with class, something that sadly died out decades ago.

comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: Dainty pair of boots the lass is wearing! And that loaf looks good. China cups too. It's a great image, if a little too posed.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Camping, but hardly "roughing it" with china and a lace table cloth :)

comment.author: 30369211@N00

comment.author: 47290943@N03
